unnormalised: A Delhi court has issued a stay order in a property dispute case filed by Mrs. Kavita Sharma against Mr. Rajesh Verma, preventing any further construction on the contested land. The case, registered under Civil Suit No. 456/2023, concerns a plot of land located at 12, Karol Bagh, New Delhi, 110005.
normalised: A Delhi court has issued a stay order in a property dispute case filed by Mistress Kavita Sharma against Mister Rajesh Verma, preventing any further construction on the contested land. The case, registered under Civil Suit Number four hundred and fifty six slash two thousand and twenty three, concerns a plot of land located at twelve, Karol Bagh, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and five.

unnormalised: Adv. Anil Kumar, representing Mrs. Sharma, argued that Mr. Verma was proceeding with construction without proper authorization and in violation of the original property agreement dated 20/02/2010. The plaintiff sought an immediate injunction to halt the ongoing construction, citing irreparable damage to the property and infringement of her rights.
normalised: Advocate Anil Kumar, representing Mistress Sharma, argued that Mister Verma was proceeding with construction without proper authorization and in violation of the original property agreement dated twentieth february two thousand and ten. The plaintiff sought an immediate injunction to halt the ongoing construction, citing irreparable damage to the property and infringement of her rights.

unnormalised: Mr. Verma's counsel, Adv. Meena Iyer, countered that the construction was within permissible limits as per the amended building plan approved by the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) on 15/05/2024. They presented documents claiming that Mrs. Sharma was aware of the modifications and had not raised objections previously.
normalised: Mister Verma's counsel, Advocate Meena Iyer, countered that the construction was within permissible limits as per the amended building plan approved by the M-C-D on fifteenth May two thousand and twenty four. They presented documents claiming that Mistress Sharma was aware of the modifications and had not raised objections previously.

unnormalised: The court, presided over by Judge R.S. Gupta, after reviewing the presented evidence and hearing arguments from both sides, has issued a temporary stay order until the next hearing scheduled for 01/08/2024. The order directs Mr. Verma to cease all construction activities on the disputed property until further notice.
normalised: The court, presided over by Judge R-S Gupta, after reviewing the presented evidence and hearing arguments from both sides, has issued a temporary stay order until the next hearing scheduled for first august two thousand and twenty four. The order directs Mister Verma to cease all construction activities on the disputed property until further notice.

unnormalised: The judge noted the need for a thorough examination of the original agreement and the amended building plan to determine the validity of the claims made by both parties. Further hearings are expected to delve into the legal intricacies of the case, potentially involving expert testimony and site inspections.
normalised: The judge noted the need for a thorough examination of the original agreement and the amended building plan to determine the validity of the claims made by both parties. Further hearings are expected to delve into the legal intricacies of the case, potentially involving expert testimony and site inspections.
